item.title: Is Managed WiFi Right for You?
item.description: By: John Shepler Broadband internet access is widely available and has become a standard expectation. Consumers rely on it to stay connected while on the move, and businesses use it to provide connectivity to customers and allow employees to work flexibly. Considering 3G and 4G cellular? Cellular broadband on smartphones is excellent for wide area coverage, but it has limitations. Data usage limits can lead to unexpectedly high costs. Additionally, many computers, tablets, and other devices lack built-in cellular connectivity, even if users are willing to pay extra for it.

item.title: Wireless Business Broadband Available In A Day
item.description: Imagine this: your new store is ready to open, everything is in place, but you can’t start selling because your internet service isn’t working. This is where Accel Networks comes in, offering a wireless solution that can get you online in just a few days. Why choose Accel Networks? Traditional broadband often involves time-consuming installations. Accel Networks bypasses this by using existing cell tower infrastructure. Their service is secure, meets payment industry standards, and covers most of the US, Canada, and Puerto Rico.

item.title: Fixed Wireless for Point of Sale Authorizations
item.description: Credit card processing is essential for modern businesses, so having a fast and reliable authorization terminal is crucial. While dial-up terminals might have been sufficient in the past, their slow speed can frustrate customers and reflect poorly on your business. Upgrading to a broadband connection is a worthwhile investment. T1 lines have become more affordable, making them a popular choice for businesses. However, they can still be expensive for smaller companies.
